Notes.Text:
This update for ImageMagick fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2025-68618: read a malicious SVG file may result in a DoS attack (bsc#1255821).
- CVE-2025-68950: check for circular references in mvg files may lead to stack overflow (bsc#1255822).
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Desktop Applications 15 SP7

Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick is free and open-source software used for editing and manipulating digital images. Prior to version 7.1.2-12, using Magick to read a malicious SVG file resulted in a DoS attack. Version 7.1.2-12 fixes the issue.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Desktop Applications 15 SP7:ImageMagick-config-7-upstream-7.1.0.9-150400.6.61.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: ImageMagick is free and open-source software used for editing and manipulating digital images. Prior to version 7.1.2-12, Magick fails to check for circular references between two MVGs, leading to a stack overflow. This is a DoS vulnerability, and any situation that allows reading the mvg file will be affected. Version 7.1.2-12 fixes the issue.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Desktop Applications 15 SP7:ImageMagick-config-7-upstream-7.1.0.9-150400.6.61.1
